ConvenientEffects.SettingAppControlsPerm: This defines the minimum permission level to see and apply Convenient Effects through the application via the button on token controls. Setting this to None will disable the button entirely.
ConvenientEffects.SettingCreateFoldersPe: This defines the minimum permission level to create new effect folders in the Convenient Effects application. Setting this to None will disable the create button entirely. Note that a user must also have the Foundry permission to create items in order for this to work.
ConvenientEffects.KeybindingToggleAppHin: This will either open the Convenient Effects app if it is closed or close it if it is currently open.
ConvenientEffects.ConfigFoundryEffectIdH: This is the foundry effect ID and can be used for finding, adding, or removing an effect.
ConvenientEffects.ConfigConvenientEffect: This is the Convenient effect ID and can be used for finding, adding, or removing an effect.
ConvenientEffects.ConfigTemporaryHint: If checked, this effect will always be labeled as a temporary effect, even if it doesn't have a duration or status.
ConvenientEffects.ConfigViewableHint: If checked, this effect will always be shown in the application.
ConvenientEffects.ConfigDynamicHint: If checked, this effect will have dynamic effects applied based on the actor data. This cannot be changed and is used for very specific effect cases.
ConvenientEffects.ConfigNestedEffectsHin: The nested effects that will be shown as options when the effect is added or removed.
ConvenientEffects.ConfigSubEffectsHint: The sub-effects that will be applied in relation to this effect. If this effect is removed, all sub-effects are automatically removed as well.
ConvenientEffects.ConfigOtherEffectsHint: The other effects that will be applied in relation to this effect. If this effect is removed, the other effects will not be automatically removed.
